page.title: List of tallest buildings in India

revisions.rev:
[[File:Mumbai Skyline at Night.jpg|thumb|[[Mumbai]] night skyline]] [[File:ImperialMumbai.JPG|thumb|[[The Imperial, Mumbai|The Imperial Towers]], [[Mumbai]] are the tallest in India.]] This '''list of tallest buildings in India''' ranks [[skyscraper]]s in [[India]] based on official height.
Most of the [[high-rise]] buildings in India are in the commercial capital [[Mumbai]]. More than 1200 high-rise buildings are already constructed in [[Mumbai Metropolitan Region]] (MMR).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.emporis.com/en/wm/ci/bu/sk/?id=102037 |title=Skyscrapers of Mumbai |publisher=Emporis.com |date=2009-06-15 |accessdate=2010-07-16}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.emporis.com/en/wm/ci/bu/sk/?id=101456 |title=Skyscrapers of Navi Mumbai |publisher=Emporis.com |date=2009-06-15 |accessdate=2010-07-16}}</ref> In addition to more than a thousand [[mid-rise]]s existing already (a building of above 12 floors is classified as a mid-rise, and buildings with 25 floors or 90 meters in height are classified as high-rises), the city is undergoing a massive construction boom, with hundreds of high-rises and more than 85 [[skyscraper]]s under construction.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.businessworld.in/bw/2010_07_17_Heaven_On_Earth.html?offset=1&max=1 |title=Heaven On Earth |publisher=Businessworld.in |date=2010-07-17 |accessdate=2010-07-30}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://week.manoramaonline.com/cgi-bin/MMOnline.dll/portal/ep/theWeekContent.do?sectionName=Business&contentId=7484495&programId=1073754899&pageTypeId=1073754893&contentType=EDITORIAL |title=The week- Mumbaiâs skyline is getting crowded |publisher=Week.manoramaonline.com |date= |accessdate=2010-08-23}}</ref>
==Tallest buildings== This lists ranks buildings in [[India]] that stand at least {{convert|90|m|ft|abbr=on}} tall, based on standard height measurement. This includes [[spire]]s and architectural details but does not include [[Radio masts and towers|antenna masts]]. Only completed buildings and under-construction buildings that have been [[Topping out|topped out]] are included.
